COURSE DESCRIPTION

This course aims to develop student’s English proficiency regarding all four language skills. Students are expected to increase their reading and writing literacy along with listening comprehension and communication competence through a variety of in-class and out-of-class activities.

REQUIREMENTS & RULES

1.  You will be asked to work in pairs and in groups. Please be a responsible partner.
2.  For every class meeting, there will be several Q & A sessions. You and your partner need to raise questions and share your thoughts to show your participation.
3.  Attendance is important.
4.  Please make sure that you have your Moodle account and check both the course site and your email regularly.

English Song Presentation (50% English, 50% Chinese)

*   Presenters (3 or 4 people in one group)

Before your presentation, you have to …

1.  find a song you like,
2.  design an activity, with a handout (A5, 3 new words, 2 phrase/idiom, 1 pattern),
3.  prepare 5 questions for a quiz in class, and
4.  turn in the handout a week before your presentation.

During the presentation, **_every_** group member has to (1) be on stage, (2) present/explain the song, and (3) answer your classmates’ questions.

*   Students who are not the presenters

During the presentation, you have to (1) work on the activity and (2) ask questions.

Dubbing (English Only)

*   Presenters (3 to 4 people in a group)

Before your performance, you have to…

1.  find an English clip (4-5 minutes) that introduces something/someone you are interested in (sports, celebrities, food, fashion, artists, etc.),
2.  watch the clip, listen and repeat what is said in the video, and
3.  post the link of the video on Moodle a week before your presentation.

During the presentation, **_each_** of you has to (1) be on stage, (2) play the video with the sound off, and (3) take turns to dub your voice into the video.

*   Students who are not the presenters need to give comments based on presenters’ performances.
